description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy and partnerships on child rights issues with stakeholders

description.narrative: Strategic use of advocacy, partnerships, public communication and communication for social change makes UNICEF a leading voice on child rights in the country and creates public support to ongoing reforms. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2019
